org.jpws.front

Interface ContainerView

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ActivitySource
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TableHandler, TreeHandler

    public interface ContainerView
extends ActivitySource
    Interface to handle general aspects of viewports to a database container's record list. This renders a displayable GUI component and deals with record selections.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getFirstSelected()
      Returns the first item of the current user selection in this view as index in the OrderedRecordList that forms the data reference of this view handler.
      int[] getSelectedItems()
      Returns all items of the current user selection in this view as an array of index values into the OrderedRecordList that forms the data reference of this view handler.
      org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] getSelectedWrappers()
      Returns all items of the current user selection in this view as an array of DefaultRecordWrappers.
      javax.swing.JComponent getView()
      Returns the visible UI-component that displays the results of this view handler.
      boolean hasUserSelection()
      Whether there exists a meaningful user selection in this view's display.
      void reconstruct() 
      void repaint() 
      void scrollToVisible(int index)
      Attempts to arrange the list display to show the item specified by its index.
      void setFont(java.awt.Font font)
      Sets the display font.
      void setSelectAll()
      Set this view to select all available items.
      void setSelectedIndex(int index)
      Sets the record item selected that belongs to the specified sort index in the OrderedRecordList that forms the data reference of this view handler.
      void setSelectedItems(int[] selection)
      Sets an array of items as the current user selection in the view.
      void setSelectedWrappers(org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] selection)
      Sets an array of DefaultRecordWrapper items as the current user selection in the view.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jpws.front.util.ActivitySource

        addActivityListener, removeActivityListener

    • Method Detail

      • getFirstSelected

        int getFirstSelected()
        Returns the first item of the current user selection in this view as index in the OrderedRecordList that forms the data reference of this view handler.
        Returns:
        sort index value or -1 of no item is selected

      • getSelectedItems

        int[] getSelectedItems()
        Returns all items of the current user selection in this view as an array of index values into the OrderedRecordList that forms the data reference of this view handler.
        Returns:
        array of int; empty array if the selection is empty

      • hasUserSelection

        boolean hasUserSelection()
        Whether there exists a meaningful user selection in this view's display. (Note that this is not equivalent with getFirstSelected() != -1 as it refers to *any* meaningful selections within implementations whose nature is unknown to this interface.)

      • getSelectedWrappers

        org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] getSelectedWrappers()
        Returns all items of the current user selection in this view as an array of DefaultRecordWrappers. This may serve as an absolute reference to the records of a list selection (instead of the relative of index positions).
        Returns:
        array of DefaultRecordWrapper; empty array if the selection is empty

      • setSelectedIndex

        void setSelectedIndex(int index)
        Sets the record item selected that belongs to the specified sort index in the OrderedRecordList that forms the data reference of this view handler.
        Parameters:
        index - of the item to be selected; -1 leads to empty selection (deselection)

      • setSelectedItems

        void setSelectedItems(int[] selection)
        Sets an array of items as the current user selection in the view. With selection == null this works as deselection.
        Parameters:
        selection - array of item indices in OrderedRecordList or null

      • setSelectedWrappers

        void setSelectedWrappers(org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] selection)
        Sets an array of DefaultRecordWrapper items as the current user selection in the view. Records that are not elements of the current view list are disregarded.
        Parameters:
        selection - array of DefaultRecordWrapper

      • setSelectAll

        void setSelectAll()
        Set this view to select all available items.

      • scrollToVisible

        void scrollToVisible(int index)
        Attempts to arrange the list display to show the item specified by its index.
        Parameters:
        index - of the item to be scrolled to

      • getView

        javax.swing.JComponent getView()
        Returns the visible UI-component that displays the results of this view handler.
        Returns:
        Component

      • repaint

        void repaint()

      • setFont

        void setFont(java.awt.Font font)
        Sets the display font.

      • reconstruct

        void reconstruct()
